name: Buckden Pike and the Polish Memorial, Upper Wharfdale

ai.summary: A demanding 29.2 km ridge hike in Upper Wharfedale, linking Buckden Pike with the Polish Memorial. The route features long ascents, exposed summits, and sweeping views, offering a classic hard ridge walk in the UK.
ai.terrain_summary: High-level ridge terrain with grassy and rocky paths, exposed summits, and occasional boggy sections. Expect stony descents, strong winds, and navigation along a continuous ridge between Buckden Pike and the Polish Memorial.
ai.safety_notes: Exposed ridges and rapidly changing weather require solid navigation and pacing. Carry a map and compass (and know how to use them), and plan for a full-day hike. Wear sturdy boots and layered, weatherproof clothing; bring a warm layer for the summit wind. Check the forecast, bring extra water and high-energy food, and have a plan for detours or turning back in poor conditions. Stay on marked paths where shown and inform someone of your route and expected return. Dogs may need to be kept under control or avoided on certain sections.
recommended_gear: Orienteering map and compass (and optional GPS)
Waterproof and windproof jacket and pants
Insulating layers and a warm hat/gloves
Water and high-energy snacks (plus electrolyte if needed)
Emergency whistle and basic first aid kit
Phone with offline maps and a portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly Mayâ€“September). The route is challenging in winter due to exposure and navigation difficulties; plan for shorter daylight hours and harsher conditions.
